item.title: White Supremacy and fatphobia are inseparable. ‚ÄúRecognize...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

White Supremacy and fatphobia are inseparable.

‚ÄúRecognize your relationship to food. Notice if it feels almost like a fight. Are you in opposition to your body? If so, look for a therapist you can relate to, like a Black therapist, who deals with eating disorders to help you achieve peace. If you can‚Äôt afford to see a therapist, you can find support groups of Black women with eating disorders run by community groups. Practice working with your intuition as well. The answers ...you seek are already there inside yourself. Mindfulness, quieting the mind, and checking in with ourselves is a powerful tool as well. Really listen to your inner voice that tells you what you really are hungry for.‚Äù

üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•

https://blackgirlnerds.com/black-women-and-hidden-eating-d‚Ä¶/

item.title: #IStandWithVelvitBeauty This GoFundMe is a call-to-action to...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#IStandWithVelvitBeauty

This GoFundMe is a call-to-action to help a Black Business owner who is in URGENT need of safety and security for her small business!

Standing in solidarity with Velv'IT Boutique Beauty, we are calling on the community and everyone who believes in the power of improving local economies to help this entrepreneur. We are raising $2,500, which will allow the boutique to get a security gate for the door, install a security system, and pay for some portion... of future surveillance costs. A security system must be put in place as soon as possible to protect the store, the employees, and the customers.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Velv'IT Boutique Beauty is a Black woman-owned beauty supply store that opened its doors in Denver, Colorado on September 21st, 2020. The company sells an array of high-quality health and beauty products, including organic and locally-sourced selections that cater to natural, curly, and textured hair. The store is service-focused and strives to provide a safe, serene, and inclusive shopping experience for customers from all walks of life. The owner, ALLurrr'em VelvIT, is not only an ambitious entrepreneur, but she is also one of the pioneers of the Black Burlesque scene in the Twin Cities.
#Blackowned #Reparations #MutualAID #WeKeepUsSafe #BlackLivesMatter

See More#ISTANDWITHVELVITBEAUTY This GoFundMe is a call-to-action to help‚Ä¶ Sydney Latimer needs your support for Help Velv'IT Boutique Beauty Buy a Security System

gofundme.com

Help Velv'IT Boutique Beauty Buy a Security System, organized by Sydney Latimer

item.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Colorado Attorneys Against Police ViolenceIf DAs don‚Äôt cover up police misconduct, why is there a need for...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

If DAs don‚Äôt cover up police misconduct, why is there a need for independent investigations? If DAs offices are truly separate from police departments, shouldn‚Äô...t their investigations be independent? To answer these questions, compare the conclusions of the independent investigation into the murder of #ElijahMcClain to elected Adams County DA Dave Young‚Äôs (now a DA in El Paso County) conclusions regarding whether APD officers had a right to contact Elijah.

The answer is simple: #DAsAreCopsToo and we must hold them accountable. Help #CAAPV in its work for DA accountability by telling us your stories of prosecutorial misconduct and discovery violations. Links in the comments. üëá

See More

item.title: TODAY: Colorado SB21-62 will be in Senate Judiciary starting at...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

TODAY: Colorado SB21-62 will be in Senate Judiciary starting at 1:30pm. Please contact Senate Judiciary urging them to pass this bill!

BLM5280 has actively fought against cash bail for several years and hosted our own Momma's Day and Father's Day bailouts. 60% of CO‚Äôs jail population is pretrial, unconvicted people who are held solely because they can't afford to pay their bond & face losing their job, their housing & custody of their kids while waiting to see a judge.

Joh...n Cooke (R): john.cooke.senate@state.co.us
Bob Gardner (R): bob.gardner.senate@state.co.us
Robert Rodriguez (D): robert.rodriguez.senate@state.co.us
Pete Lee (D) (bill sponsor) : pete.lee.senate@state.co.us
Julie Gonzales (D): julie.gonzales.senate@state.co.us

#endcashbail #freethepeople #povertyisnotacrime #peoplenotprisons #SB2162

item.title: ‚ÄúThere is a growing body of research that shows that...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúThere is a growing body of research that shows that transgender or nonbinary gender identities are normal variations in human expression of gender,‚Äù said APA President Jennifer F. Kelly, PhD. ‚ÄúAttempts to force people to conform with rigid gender identities can be harmful to their mental health and well-being.‚Äù

APA has adopted a resolution opposing efforts to change people‚Äôs gender identity, citing scientific research showing that such actions may be harmful.

apa.org

APA adopts resolution opposing biased or coercive efforts to change individuals‚Äô gender identity

item.title: Dr. Apryl Alexander will be delivering a statement detailing her...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Dr. Apryl Alexander will be delivering a statement detailing her and BLM5280‚Äôs opposition to HB 21-1030, and amendments we would approve!

Denver Alliance for Street Health Response

URGENT ACTION ALERT!

Today, HB 21-1030, the Expanding Peace Officers Mental Health Grant Program will receive public hearing in the House Public Health Committe...e at 1:30pm. While this bill positions itself to fund programs like what we've been working on with multiple cities across Colorado and even across the country, the funding is restricted to law enforcement agencies and there is other language that would further harm our efforts. Taking Denver and Aurora for example, two cities we've worked with that have either launched or approved non-police models, neither city would theoretically be eligible for this funding for non-police models. Denver's STAR lives under Denver Department of Public Health and Environment and Aurora's program will live under a director position at the municipal level, outside of the police department. If these two programs are influencing this legislation, then the bill has fallen short of even supporting those cities, as well as others as there is tremendous nuance to each city we've worked to create programs with.

We ask our supporters and community to join us in opposing this bill as it has been written and invite folks to testify. You can do so virtually by signing up at https://www2.leg.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/CLIC‚Ä¶/commsumm.nsf/signIn.xsp. At the very least, we ask that folks submit written testimony or contact their elected officials with the following demands:

- Funding being open to entities that are not strictly law enforcement. If this bill is to support community partnerships, then funding must be open to the actual community partners.

- Equal or majority funding going towards non-police models versus co-responder models. There should be a distinction between the two as they are not the same and while there has been some positive impact from co-responder programs, we have heard from social workers that they are often inhibited from doing their jobs by the commanding presence of law enforcement.

- Remove the required $2 million set aside for law enforcement mental health as that would leave almost nothing for crisis response programs.

- Finally, if legislators are to work to support local programs that are community partnerships, then there should be more due diligence in engaging with the municipalities and community organizations doing the work before moving this bill forward in any form.

We believe that the state should help municipalities work to create non-police models that we've been working on, especially as cities have continued to note funding as a barrier. However, we reject the limited confines of this particular bill and insist on more engagement from those working to introduce it.

See More

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism.
